Dialogue.NPCText:
A tall, sharp-eyed woman leans against a pillar, hood shadowing her features. The glint of a crimson blade at her side leaves no doubt: this is Nadia the Dagger.

She nods once, as if sizing you up.
“Most people in the Undermarket don’t dare speak to me. Either you’re new, or you’re reckless. What do you want?”

Option.text: How did you end up here?
What do you think of Zahid?
Who do you trust in Qasaria?

Dialogue.NPCText:
Nadia’s lips twitch in a half-smirk.
“Stories? I used to believe half of them myself. Truth is, the more legends they spread, the fewer actually try to test me.
I’ve been a caravan blade, a bodyguard, and an executioner by request. Now I’m my own master—or as close as you get in Zahid’s shadow.”

Her gaze flickers over you—appraising.
“Dangerous? Good. That’s the only language anyone understands in Qasaria’s underbelly.
If you want to be more than a rumor, you’ll need teeth. Or, you could hire mine—for a price.”

Option.text: I prefer to stand on my own.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Nadia crosses her arms.
“Born in chains. Sold between merchant princes like a bolt of silk.
Learned to fight because nobody cared if a slave girl lived. Learned to kill because that’s the only way to live free.
The Sapphire Caravans tried to break me. Zahid gave me a blade and let me choose my targets.”
She shrugs.
“Now I choose who I trust, who I follow, and who I cut. Some days, I even sleep.”

Option.text: Did you ever go back for revenge?
What keeps you loyal to Zahid?
You sound strong. I respect that.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Her smile turns cold.
“A few caravan masters went missing. A few more learned to sleep with their eyes open.
I’m not here for vengeance. That’s for the dead. I’m here for freedom. And coin.”

Option.text: Would you ever leave the Undermarket?
I want to work with you.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Nadia considers.
“If there’s a place I can walk in daylight and not have to watch my back—maybe.
Until then, this is home. Besides, nowhere else pays as well for what I do.”

Nadia’s tone is unreadable.
“Zahid doesn’t own me. He respects me. That’s rare. We have a pact—no lies, no chains, no debts unpaid.
If you’re smart, you’ll never put him in your debt, and never try to put a leash on me.”

Option.text: Do you ever argue with him?
Would you ever turn on him?

Dialogue.NPCText:
“Trust?” Nadia gives a short laugh.
“Trust is a knife. You only hand it to someone if you’re willing to bleed.
I trust Zahid, for now. Maybe Karim, on a lucky day. The rest, I trust to do what benefits them. Same as me.”

Option.text: Fair enough. Any jobs for someone like me?
That’s a bleak way to live.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Nadia sizes you up with new respect.
“You move quiet. That’s a start. Prove you can keep secrets, and I might watch your back—instead of your throat.”

Option.text: Let’s see what trouble we can make.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Nadia grins.
“He’s clever, but not always wise. I argue with him when he’s wrong.
He listens—sometimes. Sometimes, I listen. That’s why we’re both still breathing.”

Her eyes harden.
“If Zahid ever broke our pact, I’d cut him. He knows it. I respect that he’d expect nothing less.
Loyalty is earned daily, not owed. Remember that.”

Nadia leans in.
“There’s always a blade to sharpen. Right now, Zahid wants a traitor rooted out of the Undermarket. Stealth and silence—no open slaughter.
Find proof of their betrayal, and you’ll have coin and my favor. Fail, and you’ll wish you’d stayed above ground.
Are you ready?”

Option.text: I’m ready. Give me the details.
What do I do if I find them?

Dialogue.NPCText:
Nadia presses a slim parchment into your hand.
“Find the traitor, gather proof. Bring it to Zahid or me—alive, if possible. If you’re caught, I don’t know you. If you succeed, you’ll have earned more than just coin.”

“Kill only if you must. Sometimes information is worth more than blood.
Zahid likes to ask questions before he buries the answers.”

Nadia raises an eyebrow.
“You want me as muscle or as a knife? Either way, I don’t come cheap. I require proof you’re worth my time.”

Her eyes narrow—she’s testing your reputation.

Option.action: SendMessage:Nadia gives you a rare approving nod.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Nadia slips her blade back into its sheath.
“Good. For now, I’ll watch your back, not slit it.
If you cross me, it’ll be the last mistake you make.”

You sense she’ll help on your next dangerous task, for a price...

Nadia looks away.
“If you want a quiet life, stay in the sun. Shadows bite.”
